TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit FileWebResponse extends System.Net.WebResponse implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable
Public Class FileWebResponse Inherits WebResponse Implements ISerializable
type FileWebResponse = class inherit WebResponse interface ISerializable

Docs.summary: Provides a file system implementation of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> class implements the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse>`abstract` base class to return file system resources for the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> class.
Client applications do not create <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> instances directly; instead, they are created by calling the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method on a <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> instance.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method returns a <xref:System.IO.Stream> instance that provides read-only access to a file system resource.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> class relies on the <xref:System.IO.File> class for error handling and code access security.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor implements the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface for the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Close() cil managed

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.Close%2A> method cleans up the resources used by a <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> and closes the response stream by calling the <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
> [!NOTE] > The response stream must be closed to avoid running out of system resources. You can closes the response stream by calling either <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.Close%2A>
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.Close%2A> method to close the response stream.
[!code-cpp[FileWebResponse_Close#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_Close/CPP/filewebresponse_close.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[FileWebResponse_Close#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_Close/CS/filewebresponse_close.cs#1)] [!code-vb[FileWebResponse_Close#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_Close/VB/filewebresponse_close.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the length of the content in the file system resource.
Docs.value: The number of bytes returned from the file system resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ContentLength%2A> property contains the length, in bytes, of the file system resource.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ContentType As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ ContentType { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the content type of the file system resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ContentType%2A> property contains the content type of the file system resource. The value of <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ContentType%2A> is always "binary/octet-stream".
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ContentType%2A> property to obtain the content type of the file system resource.
[!code-cpp[FileWebResponse_ContentLength_ContentType#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_ContentLength_ContentType/CPP/filewebresponse_contentlength_contenttype.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[FileWebResponse_ContentLength_ContentType#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_ContentLength_ContentType/CS/filewebresponse_contentlength_contenttype.cs#1)] [!code-vb[FileWebResponse_ContentLength_ContentType#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_ContentLength_ContentType/VB/filewebresponse_contentlength_contenttype.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.IO.Stream GetResponseStream() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetResponseStream () As Stream

Docs.summary: Returns the data stream from the file system resource.
Docs.returns: A for reading data from the file system resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method returns the data stream from the file system resource.
> [!NOTE] > The response stream must be closed to avoid running out of system resources. The response stream can be closed by calling <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.Close%2A>
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method to return the data stream from the file system resource.
[!code-cpp[FileWebResponse_GetResponseStream#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_GetResponseStream/CPP/filewebresponse_getresponsestream.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[FileWebResponse_GetResponseStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_GetResponseStream/CS/filewebresponse_getresponsestream.cs#1)] [!code-vb[FileWebResponse_GetResponseStream#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_GetResponseStream/VB/filewebresponse_getresponsestream.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of header name/value pairs associated with the response.
Docs.value: A that contains the header name/value pairs associated with the response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.Headers%2A> property contains two name/value pairs, one for content length and one for content type, both of which are also exposed as properties, <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ContentLength%2A> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ContentType%2A>.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.Headers%2A> property to retrieve the name/value pairs associated with the response.
[!code-cpp[FileWebResponse_Headers#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_Headers/CPP/filewebresponse_headers.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[FileWebResponse_Headers#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_Headers/CS/filewebresponse_headers.cs#1)] [!code-vb[FileWebResponse_Headers#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebResponse_Headers/VB/filewebresponse_headers.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the URI of the file system resource that provided the response.
Docs.value: A that contains the URI of the file system resource that provided the response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ResponseUri%2A> property contains the URI of the file system resource that provided the response. This is always the file system resource that was requested.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ResponseUri%2A> to retrieve the URI of the file system resource that provided the response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is always true for [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)].

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.IDisposable.Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call Dispose() when you are finished using the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>. The Dispose() method leaves the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> in an unusable state. After calling Dispose(), you must release all references to the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> was occupying. For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
> [!NOTE] > Always call Dispose() before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> object's `Finalize` method.
